chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darien J Taulman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 3 days were granted.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.   Paid in full.  Refund balance to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions  must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions and sign releases.  Inform all treatment providers of probation conditions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommenced by Agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions, STAYED, for use of Agents discretion.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Pretrial incarceration credit sheet.

Defendant Darien J Taulman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Scholz makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant sentenced to the following.

COUNT#2:

IMPOSED

30 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 3 days) Defendant to report by 11/16/15 at 12:00 pm

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COUNT#3:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

300 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 0 days) 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions and sign releases
____Inform all treatment providers of probation conditions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 30 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions, STAYED for use of agent with court permission.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Sentencing hearing at 11-16-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Darien J Taulman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2 and 3.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 2 and 3.  Counts 1 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  Court sets this case for sentencing.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Second Amended Complaint.
Preliminary hearing on July 2, 2015 at 10:00 am..
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed..

Defendant Darien J Taulman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Complaint changing this matter to a felony.  Court accepts this filing and finds probable cause.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Complaint and requests preliminary hearing.  Defense waives time limits.  Court addresses bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Court orders defendant may report to Menomonee Falls PD for a PBT as one of his appointments for WCS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2105 at 10:00 am.
Amended criminal complaint (case is now a felony)
Hearing on June 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Darien J Taulman in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Amy Scholz appears as friend of the court.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
